Texts.Chs: 疯子所写的令人不安的笔记。
我早该回头的。我早该回头的。我早该回头的。我早该回头的。我早该回头的。我早该回头的。我早该回头的。我早该回头的。我早该回头的。我早该回头的。(以上文字重复了九十六页)
Texts.Eng: I should have turned back.I should have turned back.I should have turned back.I should have turned back.I should have turned back.I should have turned back.I should have turned back.I should have turned back.I should have turned back.I should have turned back.I should have turned back.I should have turned back... (96 more pages of this continue)

Texts.Chs: 我想麦克瑞迪或许并非我们所想象的疯狂。我觉得从那具尸体上有某种邪恶的东西被我带回去了，并且我还这里发现了更多的这些...生物，它们还是活生生的，我不经意间看到，它们似乎在模仿我们的跑动动作，不过最后只有我与另外一个人回到了基地！
Texts.Eng: I think maybe MacReady wasn't as crazy as we thought. I think something was in that corpse I brought back. I found more of these things, and with the tests I ran...well, they're still alive. Somehow, they still function. And one of them is back at the base with everyone else!

Texts.Chs: 我不知道废墟还延伸了多远，我沿着通道往下走，发现了一间坐落于黑暗之中的古老寺庙。没有光，没有声，这里是如此的压抑，雕像、文字、瓦片，它们都在讲述着一段往事。
Texts.Eng: I wonder how deep these ruins go? I've found a passage down, and find myself in a deep and ancient temple. There is no light to speak of, and utter silence reigns. It's oppressive. But these carvings, this language. Every tile tells a story.

Texts.Chs: 我发现了一种与水不一样的液体，哪怕触摸它也没有影响，这里已经是尽头，我得勇敢地潜入这不知名的液体中寻找是否隐藏有通道。我装备好供氧设备，希望它能保护我免遭厄运。
Texts.Eng: I've found some sort of liquid pool that is not unlike the waters found outside. Even a slight touch of it makes me feel strange. There's no way forward, so I am going to brave the pool...see what's within. I've jury-rigged a device I hope can protect me from the effects.

Texts.Chs: 神交给了我一个特别的任务，我应该把它的孩子与其他人分享，我们最终都将会完美地成为它的守护者，它会满足我们所需的一切...一切渴望。快来吧，我的朋友们，让我们欢聚这一刻...
Texts.Eng: It gave me a most special task. I brought its babies back to share with the others. We can all be perfect together. We can all be as one with the Watcher in the Deep. It will fill us with need and sweet, sweet hunger. Come my friends, let us share in the feast...

Texts.Chs: 我感觉到清醒正离我远去，而一股癫狂的情绪正在敲击我的小脑。我按捺住心头那股疯狂，加快我的速度，终于，我达到了尽头，在这的墙壁上有几组开关，我不停地尝试其组合，直至我找出正确的组合，我已不能回头了，因为在来路的黑暗中有某种东西，而它那吞吐舌头的声音令我惊悚万分。
Texts.Eng: My mind is slowly falling away and I can feel the bliss of madness knocking at my cerebellum. I won't yet welcome insanity. Not until I've seen the end of this place. I found some sort of combination switch. I'll tinker with it until I can access whatever it protects. I have little choice. I can hear things in the darkness, including gutteral chants in some hideous tongue.

Texts.Chs: 不，我可不会让这令人欣喜的甜蜜感离我而去，我需要找到它，它一直在呼唤着我。我击败了那些可怕的守卫，现在我可以去觐见我的神了，它就在下方，我已经迫不及待，我会吃了它赐予我的圣餐，我要把我的一切都奉献给它。
Texts.Eng: No, I will not stop the sweetness or halt the spread of this madness. I feel the need to find It. I have snuck past some horrid sentries and now go to meet with my new God. I can hear it undulating deep below. I will eat its sacrament. I found it anyway, so it's mine and I'm hungry to take what belongs to me.

The find I have just made rewrites the knowledge of the cosmos in its entirety. There are ruins past the mountain. It was a treacherous climb but well worth it. If my initial scans are correct, this site is well over 90 million years old.

Texts.Chs: 在一部分砖块上刻着某种象形图案，似乎这是记录重要事迹的唯一手段。虽然现在我了解到的不多，但毫无疑问这里曾属于某个文明。而通过指尖下各种深浅的痕迹，我确信了这个文明的种族曾在此繁衍，通过某种技术创造了一个新的生命作为他们的奴隶，但最终却遭受奴隶的反抗。
Texts.Eng: There are pictograms on some tiles, giving visual representation of events to some degree. While much is uncertain, there was definitely a civilization here. Their people flourished here and through science birthed a new race. Slaves. But all slaves eventually rebel.

Texts.Chs: 废墟之中的建筑风格、所刻文字、所绘生物不符合当前已知的任何资料，它们的一切完全违背了常理，它们似乎与维度一样无常，或小或大。当我凝望许久之后，竟然隐约地感觉到我的观念正在潜移默化。
Texts.Eng: These ruins match no known species, language or style I am aware of. Something about them is wrong, though. The angles are just...off. Dimensions seem larger or smaller than they should. It makes no sense, and it warps my perception to stare at them for any moderate length of time.

Texts.Chs: 这些奴隶开始抗争并屠杀他们的创造者，停战之后，年老的都离开了此处。他们称之为奴隶的东西是...无质、无形的？
Texts.Eng: These slave beings rose up and slaughtered most of their creators, until a truce was made and the Old Ones left this place save for the few required to keep the Slaves contained. The slave-things are some sort of amorphous, shapeless mass.
